STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 2, 2024
Michelle Lynn Carlton
Child Safe Michigan Judson CS
4410 W 13 Mile RD,
Royal Oak, MI, 48073-6515
Re: License #: CB630369213
Dear Ms. Carlton:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
7/29/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-248-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
Two of eight adoptive family evaluations did not complete the evaluation within 90
days of the agency receiving the signed application from the potential adoptive
family.
Repeat Violation Established:
Special Evaluation 2024C001145SI dated 4/15/24, CAP approved 6/12/24
2

FOM Policy 722.08D Required signatures.
Treatment plans agreement and signature
once completed and approved, the caseworker
must obtain signatures from the following
individuals, as applicable: foster parents,
relative caregivers and unrelated court
ordered caregivers, parents/legal guardians,
youth, and caregivers must check yes or no for
the following when signing treatment plans: I
have participated in the development of the
Case Service Plan and the Parent Agency
Treatment Plan.
Five of eight open foster care records reviewed did not show compliance. The
PATP was missing the required check for yes or no in the caregivers, parents, or
youth development of the case service plan.
Repeat Violation Established:
2023 Renewal, CAP Approved 6/15/2023
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
3

Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
The CAP submitted was in response to the 2023 renewal inspection completed on
6/8/2023 and the CAP was approved on 6/15/2023. The agency was cited for 3
violations, one violation was repeated this year. The repeated violations is
regarding 722-08D – PATP signatures. The agency will need to establish
additional corrective action planning for the repeated violation to ensure a
reduction of this violation.
Special Investigation 2024C0001145SI was completed on 6/8/24 and the CAP
was approved on 6/15/24. The agency was found in non-compliance with
R400.12605 (1) Adoptive family evaluation as the agency did not complete the
home evaluation within 90 days. The agency CAP includes the adoptive
supervisor will address all pending evaluations monthly with their monthly
supervision with staff. A training will be held with the adoptive staff who will sign
and date the training provided to them. This CAP is new and the agency has not
completed this CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was discussed on site on 7/3/224 with
the Chief Administrator (CA). The Chief Administrator (CA) reported the agency’s
barriers are the repeat non-compliance items which are due to extenuating
circumstances, specific worker performance, or issues with the way MiSACWIS
reports data. She said the turnover rate in foster care has affected compliance in
many ways. The CA stated foster care staff have almost completely turned over
since the last reporting period. She reported hiring and training new staff has been
one of the largest barriers. The CA reported the activity with the most positive
impact has been the weekly review of the Book of Business with the supervisors.
She reported the analyst from DHHS has started to come to the agency monthly to
review Key Performance Indicators, which has also been helpful. The CA said
sometimes the analyst is able to determine reasons why things are not showing up
as they should per performance indicators. She said a monthly review of the CAP
with supervisors has also helped to hold supervisors accountable for maintaining
compliance.
Financial Overview:
The agency certified independent auditor’s report dated September 30, 2023, and
the agency annual financial report was reviewed. There were no financial
concerns identified.
Staff Interviews:
Three staff were interviewed onsite. All three staff reported enjoying working for
the agency and their positions. Staff feel their agency is the best one to work for.
The staff interviewed praised their coworkers and spoke very highly of their
supervisors. Staff stated their supervisors are knowledgeable, supportive and
4

helpful. Staff suggested the agency return back to having staff and agency family
picnics. It was also suggested by staff that the agency provide the staff with
telephones so they would not have to use their personal telephones for agency
business.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The office appears to have adequate space and equipment for the staff members
to complete their required responsibilities. Physical CHRI and case files are all
stored securely, preventing unauthorized access. No concerns were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
07/31/2024
_________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
08/02/2024
